pt.ua.concurrent

Class Actor

  • java.lang.Object
    • java.lang.Thread
      • pt.ua.concurrent.Actor
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    java.lang.Runnable

    public class Actor
extends java.lang.Thread
    An actor module (object-oriented approach for message passing concurrent programming).

    This class implements, in an object-oriented way, the message passing thread communication mechanism.
    Important Note: external synchronization is not yet implemented.

    This class follows DbC(tm) methodology (Wikipedia). Where possible, contracts are implement with native's Java assert.

    Version:
    0.5, November 2011, 0.6, November 2012
    Author:
    Miguel Oliveira e Silva (mos@ua.pt)

    • Method Detail

      • futureDone

        protected void futureDone(pt.ua.concurrent.Future future)
        Indicates that the routine attached to future is done. (This method is to be used by actor descendant classes.)

        requires: future != null
        requires: isAlive()

        Parameters:
        future - the future object

      • inPendingRoutine

        protected void inPendingRoutine(Actor.Routine r)
        Queue's a routine for execution by the actor. (This method is to be used by actor descendant classes.)

        requires: r != null

        Parameters:
        r - the routine object

      • terminate

        public void terminate()
        Terminate te execution of actor. The actor will terminate as soon as its pending queue is empty.

        requires: isAlive()

      • terminated

        public boolean terminated()
        Is the actor terminated?
        Returns:
        boolean true if the actor has finished, false otherwise

      • runUniqueInvocation

        protected boolean runUniqueInvocation()
        Has run not executed yet? (This method is only for internal usage to ensure that run method is executed only by the thread's start method.)
        Returns:
        boolean true if run has not yet started execution, false otherwise

      • run

        public void run()
        The actor's message handling routine. (This method is to be executed only by thread's start method.)
        Specified by:
        run in interface java.lang.Runnable
        Overrides:
        run in class java.lang.Thread
